intro: Leptodactylon brevifolium, commonly known as the short-leafed moss, is a species of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, closely packed leaves. The plant typically grows on rocks, soil, or decaying wood in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are often hidden beneath the leafy layers. Leptodactylon brevifolium plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms.
